title: How to Line a Swiss Roll Tin

steps.headline: Place the base of the Swiss roll tin onto a sheet of baking paper (parchment paper).
steps.description: Trace around the circle of the base.

steps.headline: Measure the depth of the Swiss roll tin.
steps.description: Add another 2 centimeter (0.8 in) or 3/4 of an inch and draw a line. From this measurement, measure the same distance from your drawn line. Cut all around for that distance.

steps.headline: Crease the paper along the drawn lines.
Cut a diagonal corner from from each outside corner to the nearest drawn corner.
Press the paper down into the base and along the sides of the tin.
Add the Swiss roll mixture and bake according to the recipe's instructions.

text: Place the base of the Swiss roll tin onto a sheet of baking paper (parchment paper). Trace around the circle of the base. Measure the depth of the Swiss roll tin. Add another 2 centimeter (0.8 in) or 3/4 of an inch and draw a line. From this measurement, measure the same distance from your drawn line. Cut all around for that distance. Crease the paper along the drawn lines.  Cut a diagonal corner from from each outside corner to the nearest drawn corner.  Grease the tin.  Press the paper down into the base and along the sides of the tin. Make any adjustments needed. Add the Swiss roll mixture and bake according to the recipe's instructions.
